name: Who Wrote What Multiple Choice Quiz | Mixed Literature | 5 Questions

questions.text: Who wrote Of 'Mice and Men', 'The Grapes of Wrath', 'Cannery Row', 'East of Eden'?
questions.explanation:
John Steinbeck.

	John Steinbeck (1902-1968) American novelist, story writer, playwright, essayist, and screenplay writer. Steinbeck received the Nobel Prize for Literature in 1962.

questions.text: Who wrote 'Less Than Zero', 'American Psycho', 'The Rules of Attraction', and 'The Informers'?
questions.explanation:
Bret Easton Ellis.

	Simon and Schuster gave Bret a {$300,000} advance for American Psycho then refused to publish it after women's groups and women within the company protested. Luckily, the book was picked up by Vintage.

questions.text: Which one of the following books was not written by L. Frank Baum?
questions.explanation:
The Magical Land of Oz.

	L(yman) Frank Baum (1856-1919) American journalist and writer, whose best-known book is 'The Wonderful Wizard of Oz' (1900).

questions.text: What is the name of the priest that wrote 'Fall From Grace', 'Wages of Sins', 'Thy Brother's Wife', 'Cardinal Sins'?
questions.explanation:
Andrew Greeley.

	A native of Chicago, Reverend Andrew M. Greeley, is a priest, distinguished sociologist and best-selling author.

questions.text: Who wrote 'The War of The Worlds', 'The Island of Dr. Moreau', 'The Invisible Man' and 'The Time Machine'?
questions.correct: H. G. Wells & H G Wells & H.G. Wells & HG Wells
questions.explanation:
H. G. Wells & H G Wells & H.G. Wells & HG Wells

	H(erbert) G(eorge) Wells (1866-1946) English novelist, journalist, sociologist, and historian, whose science-fiction stories have been filmed many times.
